description: From Latin corporātīvus, from the participle stem of corporō (“I embody”).

adjectives.description: corporative (comparative more corporative, superlative most corporative)

entries.meaning: pertaining to corporativism (also called corporatism); based on collective action or responsibility; especially of a state governed by or structured into separate bodies of classes, professions etc.
examples: Since the Middle Ages, France had developed into a ‘society of orders’, that is, an environment in which a complex set of institutions and corporative bodies enjoyed distinct legal status.
